import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline
source.ddca4449:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,8))
p=sns.barplot(x='artist',y='title_count',data=top_artists)
plt.title('Greatest artists of all time !!!',fontsize=15)
plt.xlabel('Artist',fontsize=8)
for t in p.patches:
        #print(t)
        p.annotate("{:.0f}".format((t.get_height())), (t.get_x() + t.get_width() / 2., t.get_height()),
             ha='center', va='center', fontsize=15, color='black', xytext=(0, 10),
             textcoords='offset points')
p.set_xticklabels(p.get_xticklabels(),rotation=90)
plt.ylabel('Title Count',fontsize=8)
plt.show()
source.391eda58: ## Reading the data and quality check
source.2be58743: John Lennon and Paul McCartney have written 19 out of 20 songs whereas George Harrison has written one song.Can we check to see whether the songs featured in Greatest songs have been written by same writers for artist or they are different ?
source.c6a42a86: Beatles are in the top spot with 20 labels followed by Bob dylan and Elvis Presley.What are those albums?
source.a097d5e6: The rows appear to have been duplicated.Lets removed them.
source.309bf4d7: Streak and position have null values.All other columns have no null columns.
source.972292c2: There are 50 duplicates which got removed.
source.66e578b2:
Overall,John Lennon and Paul McCartney from The Beatles have produced 19 titles while Mick Jagger,Keith Richards from The rolling stones have 10 titles to their credit.

The hypothesis that the songs are written by same writers for the artist does not hold true.Only for The Beatles it is true.

Lets check their top position streak.
source.846b17d9: 248 artists have composed top 500 greatest songs of all time.Who are the top 5 artists ?
